Siam @ Siam Design Hotel Pattaya
8.6 Excellent
Based on 5859 reviews

It is a fantastic hotel! We stayed at Executive corner rooms with nice sea view and very cozy soft sofa corner which you can separate from the room by the curtain and have a nice relaxing time.

We even asked for an extra blanket and my kid slept there over the night. Try out the club lounge which is included in this room type! Free snacks with drinks (tea/coffee/soft drink/alcohol).

Show more
Anna , Russia
The Berkeley Hotel Pratunam
8.1 Excellent
Based on 27365 reviews

overall this hotel is good and clean..and its so strategic to everywhere..platinum mall, pratunam market open from morning around 7am, pantip mall, mcdonal,starbucks coffee and talad neon market everday open from 5pm till midnite.

. -the negetive of this hotel..that the cleaness of the room..we r stay here for 5 nites..they not clean properly since first 1nite we r staying..still dirty even in the bathroom too..hair still everwhere.. for check out we r calling from our room for the troller luggages..and wait till more that half a hour..we call till 2 times and they call back only ask r we still need the trolley luggages😧..i dont know is it the management not good or there is no trolley at all..and suddenly the receptionist calling they r asking are we want to check out today..and i said yes we want to check out but we r still waiting the trolley luggs for more than half an hour.. overall everything its good nice n clean hotel at the lobby..they give welcome drink everyday..but for the future if i come to bkk i will back to this hotel again..

Show more
Agung , Indonesia
Modena by Fraser Bangkok
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1234 reviews

This was my second stay at this hotel, after an earlier visit in Feb 2017. At US$55/night for a swanky 4-star hotel right next to the subway, this comes in at a very attractive price point.

Several minor blips, however, came along the way: 1. I requested for twin beds at the time of reservation, and further confirmed this via email with the hotel. However, it was not available upon check-in and only upon insistence as well as half an hour of waiting was I provided with twin beds. 2. Taxi drivers, in order to get to the hotel, have to make one big round if not coming down via Rama 4. Accessibility is compromised despite the good location. 3. Lack of a swimming pool. Other than that, I give credit for the hotel being able to live up to its expectations. This include: - Nice new clean rooms - Quality KOHLER bathroom fittings - 2 pillows each, comfortably firm beds - Strong and powerful wifi, where the users do not have to login over and over again - Good location

Show more
Jia , Singapore
The Palayana Resort & Villas Hua Hin
8.6 Excellent
Based on 300 reviews

Hotel The view from the room was fantastic and it was huge. From the balcony, we overlook to the sea and we can watch the sunrise.

However, the cleanliness of the room could be better and they could maintain the bathroom well for a better experience. Food The breakfast was great as you look out to the beach. The variety was excellent and their scrambled eggs were great! Pool The pool seems a bit dirty and doesn't look like they have maintained it. There weren't any pool towels available for use and the staff just told us they ran out. Even at 9.30 in the morning. Note: They reuse the bedroom slippers. So if the previous user has smelly feet, good luck to you. For such a high-end resort, they should replace the bedroom slippers after each guest checks out and not reuse them. Oh, in case you break a wine glass, it cost 270 baht for one.

Show more
Lilian , Singapore
Le Bali Resort & Spa
6.6 Good
Based on 6 reviews

Grande Centre Point Hotel Terminal 21
8.6 Excellent
Based on 11994 reviews

5-star complex linked to mall with full facilities and modern design. We had room on the higher floor 30 and room had kitchenette, full sized fridge & washing machine - very handy We enjoyed our stay here.

You can get self-serve coffee / drinks in the lobby and lounge, which is really handy and useful, escalator to the train station from the lobby or door into the mall. Mall has food floors, restaurants, pharmacy, supermarket, clothing and other speciality shops and Robinson store next door. Good pool, kids play room, good gym. Points for hotel attention - (1) shower pressure and temperature surges (not good for children), (2) breakfast can be crowded on some days (had to queue) and they don't serve machine & bean coffee (small point but disappointing).Overall, liked the place and would return.

Show more
Gary , Australia
Grande Centre Point Hotel Ratchadamri
8.6 Excellent
Based on 9822 reviews

This hotel is very close to shopping malls and 2 nearby BTS stations which is reachable by walking for no more than 10-15 minutes.

Traffic jam to the hotel by car can't be avoided during rush hours. A small convenience store is reachable by 3 minutes walking from the hotel. The room is clean and nicely equipped with five stars hotel amenities plus a washing machine. Ask for high floor to get a nice view to the Lumphini Park. The mini bar in the room is free but be careful with your ordered taxi service through the hotel concierge since the taxi drivers mostly ask for fix fare (not metered).

Show more
Halim , Indonesia
Baiyoke Sky Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 21994 reviews

Baiyoke sky was not our initial planned accommodation but this decision was well made. :) we were given free upgrade to a lady's floor at 48th upon check in and we were also given a nice surprise on our last evening.

Not sure how they knew it's my birthday, they actually presented a complimentary cake and fruits in our room on the last evening! We also have chosen to dine at the 69th floor International and Thai buffet restaurant and we are so pleased with the service and food variety. The environment is very welcoming and we felt very well taken care. Though the location is not near bts station and hey, it's definitely an easy route to the airport from the hotel. Overall, it's a great stay and I do recommend you guys to give it a try! :) cheers!

Show more
Maggie , Singapore
Arnoma Grand
7.6 Very good
Based on 9618 reviews

The location is the only Pro here. I requested for 2 rooms nearer the lift cos I would be staying alone in one room and the corridors are dark.

I was however given 2LAST rooms, one next to th exit and both rooms on different levels. I asked if I could have a room change but the staff said there were huge groups and could not accommodate and everything was subject to availability. Which I understand, but their attitude was just bad? If not for the good location I wouldn't choose this hotel. There are too many mirrors in the room, the room corridors are dim, the Tv was not working and it felt creepy. Not recommended for a solo traveller.

Show more
Charmaine , Singapore
Centre Point Pratunam Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7328 reviews

This hotel is absolutely wonderful for my family . One of the factor is its location in the heart of Pratunam area.

You can just walk to Platinum Fashion Mall for around 5 minutes! Besides, there is a kids playing area for my toddler and he loves it so much. It is easy for you to get food nearby and for me as a muslim, there are nearby Halal restaurants such as Siam Ceylon and Noor Restaurant just around 20 metres located on the right side of the hotel. The staffs are friendly and can speak English reasonably. There is a taxi counter at the front door of the hotel so that you can get the taxi easily and wouldn't get cheated by the taxi driver since the price is fix. I will reccomend this hotel to everyone especially family with young child and i will return to this hotel again next time without a doubt.

Show more
Eddy , Malaysia
Grande Centre Point Sukhumvit 55 Thong Lo
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1072 reviews

We very much enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is very nicely decorated, modern and clean. The rooms were large and nicely decorated.

The breakfast area was large and the food was good. Staff were very friendly. The highlight was the onsen in the hotel as it was the most beautiful onsen I have been to and I have visited many in Japan previously. They had 5 different onsen pools plus a whirlpool/jacuzzi like onsen pool that you can sit or stand in. Each pool was clearly labelled with their benefits and had a digital display showing the pools temperature. There was also a sauna and steam room. The locker key is a digital wristband but be careful not to place it inside the locker as the door locks automatically. Would love to come again and stay longer next time.

Show more
Gerald , Canada
Grande Centre Point Hotel Ploenchit
8.4 Excellent
Based on 5816 reviews

..but you should've trained housekeeping staff better. The room we stayed in, all plug points are faulty.

I couldn't even charge my phone. Called to ask for adapter, housekeeping was sent up later - insisting that my charger was faulty. (it was perfectly fine when I stayed in Aloft Sukhumvit), she walked in to our room to check - now this was what I was unhappy about. it was 11pm, not only she didn't ask if she could come in, she barged in. then walked around the room checking every points. (just give us the adapter!) finally gave us adapter. then on our second night.. five minutes after we came back, hubby heard the bell, walked to the door, (one seconds away) and already housekeeping had opened the door. thankfully we were fully dressed! I will return, because the room is very clean! But I hope housekeeping staff are trained to be more courteous when facing guest... like wait for ten seconds before going in a room...

Show more
Su , Malaysia
Chatrium Hotel Riverside Bangkok
8.7 Excellent
Based on 8875 reviews

The only place we came across in a month in Thailand that actually catered for English speaking tourists that had plenty of staff who understood us and could easily converse with us.

plenty of English tv channels aswell.staff were awesome.My wife was not well on our last day so we decided on paying extra for a late check out.After explaining the situation to the staff at reception they allowed us extra time at no cost. Both my wife and myself would like to thank the management and staff for making our adventure in Thailand so much fun. Its not far from a lot of markets,and the Bangkok rail system. Can you please pass on to the concierge desk for us that there service is the best weve ever had and you need to pay them more. Regards Scott and Tracy Forsyth

Show more
SCOTT , Australia
Siam Kempinski Hotel Bangkok
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 1489 reviews

Nice hotel as expected. Room was well kept. Turn down service was a little inconsistent. Had Milk and chocolate for the first day, ice for the 2nd day, and bed room slippers next to the bed on the third day.

Bar was free and topped up each day. Hotel staff was pleasant from check in to check out. Only thing I did not like was that Agoda's category of the rooms did not match the hotel's. What was premium was entry class at the hotel, so not sure whether it was really an honest deal. You just have to take a chance.

Show more
Daniel , Singapore
Emporium Suites by Chatrium
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3503 reviews

Very convenient hotel located just next to the Emporium mall and BTS. This gives a wide range of food choices ranging from restaurants and food courts (in the malls) to street food (near the BTS).

Room was quite big with a separate small kitchen area, which was nice. Beds were also comfortable and you can request for different pillow types. Toilet amenities were all provided. This hotel has the best (free) wifi that I've ever experienced during my travels, the connection was very stable regardless of where I was (within the hotel) with decent speed. Was provided with a tourist card upon check-in that lets us enjoy some discounts in the mall's supermarket, food hall, and department store. Overall, very good experience. Will definitely consider this hotel again if I return to Bangkok.

Show more
Jia , Singapore
Prince Palace Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 12360 reviews

I had booked a suite for a deal on Agoda. I could have cried when I saw it. Stained, worn carpet, ancient furniture and wooden TV- my old student flat was cleaner and more modern! After I asked for a better room - any room- they gave me the key for 2 more.

One another horrific suite and the other a decent double in tower A. The manager asked me not to write a negative review and I wouldn't have done except the room was crawling with small cockroaches. My son zapped several, and even after housekeeping had been in 3 times, the dead bugs remained. One even got into my underwear drawer! The hotel is huge and there is no advice/ information about the hotel or the local area. There are 2 pools but most people didn't seem to know about the larger one by the spa. Both pools had no shade at all-pretty unbearable in 36c heat. Book this place if you're a hard up back packet and want a large room, otherwise avoid or be ready to be very disappointed.

Show more
jane , United Kingdom
Asia Hotel Bangkok
7.6 Very good
Based on 13195 reviews

My First time staying at this hotel. I have always stayed at the nasa vegas but sadly the quality of everything has gone downhill, especially the unedible breakfast.

So, I thought I would try the Asia, at a slightly higher price. I have to say the extra is well worth it. The location is excellent being very close to the Siam center and Central World. The facilities are great with two swimming pools and the buffet breakfast is unbeatable. The room was very clean and although a little dated by modern standards you do feel like you are in a quite posh hotel. The towels and changed every day and the sheets too if you want. Our beds were made up while we went for breakfast. In the cheaper rooms there is no free tea or coffee, which is a great shame as it just lets the experience down a little. The corridoor carpets could do with replacing but the room carpets and much much better than the rather dirty ones at the Nasa Vegas. You do get two bottles of free water though, plus the usual shampoo, soap etc. The shampoo is lovely by the way. All in all I would recommend this place at the current price of about £40 per night including breakfast and taxes.

Show more
Wayne , United Kingdom
Centara Grand at Central World Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 7532 reviews

It was good location, great staff and good room. Especially, rooftop bar and restaurant was really nice.

And hotel restaurant (not rooftop one) is opened 24/7. I arrived at Bangkok late, and next shopping malls like Paragon and Central World was closed at about 10pm, so it was so helpful. Only one thing disappointed was that it was so complicated to access from BTS to hotel. I'm gonna share how to access from Chidlom BTS station. Heading to 1, 6 Exit and passed Intercontinental Hotel, there's sign of Central World. Going INSIDE 7th floor, and there's a way to mall parking between Cinema and Glossary store. When you go out from shopping mall, you can find parking elevator hall on your left handside. 23rd floor is the hotel reception. If you go to hotel by a cab, it's pretty easy though.

Show more
Tomofumi , Japan
Dream Hotel Bangkok
8.4 Excellent
Based on 7653 reviews

Great location but the staff were really bad except in the bar upstairs not smiling and not friendly and they should tell you need to pay a deposit before you move in as I spoke to them on the phone before but no one mentioned it then I was made to wait at reception while I went to the ATM they seriously need to improve customers service with a smile This is Thailand after all , also please be aware unless stated before hand breakfast is not included for 2600 baht a night with no breakfast is a rip off me and my daughter paid an extra 675 THB I'm really not a person that writes bad reviews ever but this deserved one please up your game.

Wasana , Thailand
Shangri-La Hotel, Bangkok
9 Excellent
Based on 2575 reviews

Excellent location on river front but only 4☆ due to the drive and traffic chaos to get there. But once there you are treated (in my opinion) to everything that makes it a great place to stay.

Friendly attentive staff who did everything above and beyond their job description. Restaurant... for my family and me fitted the bill exactly. Our room was just perfect. The fixtures and fitting were spot on. Will i return. You bet your life we will. I see it as the perfect way to finish our vacation off. A little bit of 5☆ spoil.

Show more
Roger , United Kingdom
Arte Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1259 reviews

The hotel is very modern, clean and looks amazing. It really has the wow factor. The room we stayed in was spotlessly clean and very comfortable.

My girlfriend and I loved it. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. The location near Terminal 21 shopping mall is great for shopping and eating at mid range to classy restaurants and there's also the cheaper Thai foodcourt upstairs that has amazing Thai food, plus there's the multitude of eating and entertainment options on Sukhumvit Road - very close to Soi 11. The location is also great for getting around Bangkok and is just a few minutes walk to the BTS Skytrain and MRT underground transport systems. We will definitely stay here again.

Show more
Paul , United Kingdom
Hope Land Executive Residence Sukhumvit 46/1
7.6 Very good
Based on 7515 reviews

Rooms are large with separate shower and bathtub. Hairdryer, fridge, desk, wardrobe and place to easily open bags, etc.

Maids clean well and leave water, fresh towele, etc. Building is dated but lobby is very nice with tea and instant coffee 24x7. Bellmen to help with bags coming and leaving. Great Japanese restaurant right next door and close walk to BTS. We booked before with breakfast and thought it was a great bargain (about $44 USD through Agoda). This time we paid more, about $47, but did not realize til we checked in that breakfast was not included. Without breakfast, maybe not such a great deal, but my fault for not looking closer at Agoda option selected. We were happy with our stay anyway and do like the rooms there!

Show more
Samuel , United States
Novotel Bangkok Platinum Pratunam
8.5 Excellent
Based on 5986 reviews

I contacted Novotel Hotel directly via my company email and phone to make airport transfers for my important corporate guests.

Everything was good until payment sets in. They wanted me to pay via credit card but because this is an airport transfer fee paid via company claims, i requested for an invoice payment instead. They returned with proforma invoice (invoice without invoice no.) and my finance rejected it 3 working before the trip. I immediately reached out to them asking for an invoice with invoice no. but the reservation manager only replied 2 days later and insist that it is not required for the invoice no. until i threatened that payment cannot be made. Once the revised invoice have been received , I immediately expedite the invoice. However, this caused the payment to be delayed as most people would know Telegraphic Transfers (TT) requires at least 3 working days. I called the hotel again to ensure that they would arrange for transfers and explained to them on possible delayed payment. The reservation manager agreed to give me time to Monday for my company TT to come through on the condition that i give my credit card details to block the amount. However, today(Monday), i have been notified that the airport transfer fee have been charged to my guest as incidentals when they checked out on the last day which was on Sunday. if I would want the guest to pay for the airport transfer fee, i would not have rushed the payment. For your information, it is only for THB 4800.

Show more
Joey , Singapore
Novotel Bangkok On Siam Square Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7441 reviews

We stayed at the suite room in the Premier Floor and was entitled to personalised check-in and check-out services, usage of Premier Lounge and another perks.

As a premier floor guest, you may have your own privacy of dining in the lounge for breakfast. Buffet spread is limited. On our first night, we experienced vibrations in the room while sleeping. The next morning, we experienced vibrations at the hotel buffet restaurant. We clarified with the staff, he told us that it could be the washing machines at work as there was no indication of earthquakes. Pros: good location, situated behind Siam BTS, massage parlours and food shops outside hotel area, walking distance to all the Siam shopping malls Cons: service was inconsistent, some staff were rude when we asked for directions Overall, if the service could be improved, i would highly recommend this hotel in terms of its prime location.

Show more
Penelope , Singapore
GLOW Pratunam Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 8846 reviews

Had booked this hotel as my boyfriend stayed here the previous time and he loved it. Was my first time and I understand immediately why he liked it.

The hotel is located on the busy roads along platinum mall which makes it slightly harder for pick up of taxi/grab/uber. The drivers generally don't know where is the exact location of the hotel, so have to guide them to a drop off (Macdonald is the landmark). Otherwise walking distance to malls and night market and local street food. Many options around the hotel and many money exchange shops if you need more baht after massive shopping at platinum mall. Room surpassed expectation, being huge and bed was comfy! Loved the connecting wardrobe between bathroom and bedroom which makes it much easier to clothe ourselves after shower. Friendly service staff as they help to guide you to the hotel when you first reach, to your rooms, and check in and out was quick and smooth.

Show more
Krise , Singapore
lebua at State Tower
8.8 Excellent
Based on 11558 reviews

I have stayed in many 5* hotel, most of them give me very warm welcome and superb service. But Lebua State simply turn me down.

I booked my room through Agoda and this is a prepaid room. However I failed to show the credit card upon check in (no clause stated the credit card has to be present upon check in) hence the staff said they need to cancel my Agoda booking and process a net new booking right away. According to the staff that is their hotel policy. I felt uncomfortable but i still let them charge my card for the room rate and deposit. Untill today I yet to received the $$ which i booked from Agoda, according to the hotel @_@ Nevertheless, the condition of the room was not really 5* as is it old and the shower is not fuctioning properly. I have cold water intermediately during my shower. The SKY bar .....poor environment with over charged beverage price. No next time for me.

Show more
Maisie , Malaysia
Centara Watergate Pavillion Hotel Bangkok
8.4 Excellent
Based on 4452 reviews

This hotel, although slightly hard to find for taxi drivers as it is above a shopping Mall down a side street is in a fantastic place for shopping.

Right in the centre of the Pratunam district. The roof top bar is amazing so use the 2-for-1 vouchers you get at check in for cocktails and the experience. CONS: Katagroup bills this hotel as a "luxury resort" but after having stayed at several truly luxurious hotels in Thailand, including the Sofitel Krabi Phokeethra down the road, this is not a luxury hotel. If you are just looking for the party you should probably go spend far less on the party beach. If you are looking for isolation and empty beaches then Ko lanta would be a better choice (or perhaps Zeavola on Phi Phi).

The only caveat is that if you have mobility issues then these rooms might not be ideal since normally you access them by going up somewhat steep stairs (it's a bit of a hike but totally worth it). After talking to people who stayed there I'd say Zeavola is going to give you more in the way of "luxury" service but they are too far from the downtown area to allow for convenient access to nightlife, don't have as perfect a view, and the cost is significantly more than what you'll pay here. the staffs are rather helpful. near the condo is a small market which you can go buy foods and things you need, pretty decent for travellers like us. there is a small kitchen inside our room as well which we used it to cook our breakfast. there are only 2 cons for this condo; first, this hotel is not actually a hotel, but a condo, which means each room has individual owner and has no reception or lobby, as well as breakfast. second, this condo has a water park which means there are a lot of kids days and nights which, if you booked a lower floor room, can disturb your sleeping. the rest are perfect we wish we could stay there more and i would recommend this place for my family and friends :))

Show more Kwok , Singapore Early Bird Bed & Breakfast 8.9 Excellent Based on 977 reviews for two nights we occupied a double on the 3rd floor. upon moving from the first floor, via stairs, nobody offered to help with bags: here's the key, your in room __. the room was disappointing. smaller than the first floor twin (by about 25%), the room was shuttered with no glass. either the shutters were open and light could come in and the a/c was off or the shutters were closed, a/c was required and no sunlight entered. neither of these were satisfactory. the bathroom had a slightly bigger window (still no screen) and didn't smell modly. breakfast was served more promptly both of these days. guay jap (soup) and kao tom (boiled rice) are very good. egg breakfasts looked good but didn't try them. options including a coconut and/or orange juice and pleasant. a rather annoying aspect to the hotel was the electronic key entrance. after 10pm the front is closed and one must use the keycard to unlock the door. this is also true if one desires to leave the hotel. as two people, one of whom wanted to stay out late, it was cumbersome because the person in the room needed to come downstairs and let me in. in the morning when one of us wanted to take early pictures it was again cumbersome because i needed to be let out. there is no ability to let yourself out of the place without the key. aside from being very inconvenient it's rather annoying and potentially dangerous. Show more douglas , United States Wonderful Pool House at Kata 9.4 Exceptional Based on 67 reviews Very nice place with a big pool and a small pool. Rooms are clean, located in a very quiet area of Kata but not more than 5 minutes to the center on foot and 10min. to beautiful beach of Kata. Breakfast is plentiful and everyday they cook for you eggs and bacon. We were with our 2 young daughters and they were so sad to leave. But to be honest the best of best is the staff. They are so kind and knowledgeable. They have been way beyond their obligations when my wife forgot her credits cards in the safe. The wonderful lady drove all the way from Kata to our next hotel in Kamala to bring back the cards. On the same day. Thank you very much. Show more Sébastien , Switzerland Hunwa Guest House 8.6 Excellent Based on 49 reviews Quiet, modern, fresh towels daily. 10 min walk to supermarket to pick up groceries at (Makro opens at 6am on Cnr Taina road and patak Rd) - very useful if you are doing a tour with an early pick up time. Most shops in Phuket do not open until 10 am. The air conditioning in the room is super cool, a refreshing change from the humidity. The showers are hot. There is a laundry on Taina rd that you can wash your clothes for 30 baht, and driers. The safe in the room works really well. I was in a balcony room( not the street side) and it was nice and quiet. The Bathroom is quite warm, so you can hang your wet bathers in there overnight to dry. Tip: pick up a poncho for your tours , when it rains halfway through your tour to islands, you will be thankful to have one. They are 55 baht from the tourist shop below the guesthouse. Show more Sarah , Australia White Ivory Bed and Breakfast 9.1 Exceptional Based on 102 reviews The hotel is beautiful with soft beds and delicious breakfast. You couldn't find better hosts than the family who owns and operates the facility, they truly go above and beyond. The BTS station is about 2 blocks away and is a snap to get into the city. That being said, the only food in the area is from street cards and there are no shops or massage parlors at all- anywhere. It's not a place tourists ever go - which makes it that much cooler to be there. Show more Aisha , United States Thai Thai Sukhothai Guesthouse 8.8 Excellent Based on 1599 reviews The staff really are wonderfully welcoming and friendly. Guests are given a lot of information about what's nearby, including a list of restaurants with opening/closing times. This is unusual in the region, and was very helpful. The bungalows are comfortable and very clean, with large patios. Good water pressure in the shower. If you like Thai and regional TV (I do!) you will also love the selection of channels. Breakfast was excellent - you select from a list of hot dishes the night before, and also receive toast, fruit and yoghurt. I have some allergies, and the staff went out of their way to accommodate me. So I ate like a prince each morning. Like most places in Sukothai, there is a fleet of rental bicycles available. They are the same basic, uncomfortable "Crocodile" bikes rented throughout the region. My Croc got me through 2 days of very full cycling, without any issues. But if you are able to bring your own bike, you may be happier on the ride. I would definitely stay at Thai Thai again. It's nice enough that I'd even book my mom a night there! Show more Jeff , Canada View Talay 6 Pattaya Beach Condominium by Honey 8.1 Excellent Based on 799 reviews I have stayed before in Hard Rock Hotel and LK Empress, both nice hotels. Some apparment in the huge View Talay 6 tower are run by a charismatic lady called Honey. At Honey's I liked the great value for money and the condominium feeling. Staff was very friendly and this is important: very helpful. For instance, when I complained about a bad smell in the bathroom, somebody came and solved the problem. When the safe did not work, somebody came and solved the problem. I had asked for room cleaning every second afternoon and this is exactly how it went. Of course, I always leave 20 baht or so every other day on the pillow for the room maids. I will certainly be back to this place. Other infos you will find in the other comments. Show more Dr , Germany View Talay 6 By Pat 42 8.4 Excellent Based on 33 reviews David Residence 8.6 Excellent Based on 240 reviews I enjoyed my stay as I was only looking for a comfortable place to sleep. The bed was very comfortable, the room was super clean with a nice shower and bathroom and it was walking distance to the airport. The only bad thing was I could only get the Internet to work in the hallway and they are still doing construction so they were cutting tile with a saw outside my room at 8:30 am but that was the time I had to get up anyway, so it didn't bother me too much. It was very quiet at night and I did not notice the sounds of the airplanes very much. I did not try any food at this hotel. Show more Mackie , Canada Rocco Huahin Condominium 7.4 Very good Based on 283 reviews I was part of a group who spent Songkran week in Hua Hin. Each room was at capacity. The rooms were comfortable, but definitely a bit tight when at max capacity. The fold out beds in the couches were great, we were well taken care of as we came to the hotel. Even though it was a holiday week, hotel staff were on the premises and able to assist us. Directly under the hotel was a place to get food and drinks, and we were a five minute walk from the bus station, a shopping mall, and the beach. I would definitely stay here again! Show more Holly , United States D Apartment 1 8.3 Excellent Based on 129 reviews Pre booked at D.apartments 1. Thro Agoda. Arrived went to reception desk. Lady asked my name. Never asked for passport (requiered by Thai law. ) Never asked how i would be paying or if i had pre booked. She had agoda book in front of her. No computer . Just gave me a key. When i came to check out she asked for 13000. Baht. I said i had paid thro Agoda. She checked book. Said you were a no show . I said how can i be a noshow when i had just stayed in her hotel after heated words she said she d accept 8000.baht. almost £200.extra. i paid left in discust never again... Show more peter , United Kingdom Atlantis Condo & Water Park Pattaya by The Sea 6.6 Good Based on 420 reviews the condo has a very big water park which gave us a lot of good time, especially for family travellers with kids. the staffs are rather helpful. near the condo is a small market which you can go buy foods and things you need, pretty decent for travellers like us. there is a small kitchen inside our room as well which we used it to cook our breakfast. there are only 2 cons for this condo; first, this hotel is not actually a hotel, but a condo, which means each room has individual owner and has no reception or lobby, as well as breakfast. second, this condo has a water park which means there are a lot of kids days and nights which, if you booked a lower floor room, can disturb your sleeping. the rest are perfect we wish we could stay there more and i would recommend this place for my family and friends :)) Show more Possavee , Thailand BB Garden Resort 8.2 Excellent Based on 311 reviews It's like an oasis in a Bangkok desert! A truly home coming feeling after another hot day out. The room is big, clean and well maintained. This hotel has a mini gym! My room has a nice little balcony - and I can smoke there! The staff is helpful. The only problem is the hotel is located pretty deep in a small road (Soi 3) from the main road. Amenities are available as you walk out to the main road. Getting a cab from the hotel is a challenge. Just need to walk for about 100m to the main "small road" and wait for 5 to 10 minutes. The place is quiet at night...and that's another reason to stay here again! Show more Nelson , Singapore My loft residence 8.2 Excellent Based on 173 reviews I love this place! Staff was helpful and place was clean. And, if your looking for a great place to eat, Dino's across the street have some great home cooked meals. The only downfall is, the place is kind of out of the way from everywhere we wanted to go. Taxi drivers did not want to take us to places cus it was simply out of the way or there was a communication barrier. The district is more like a local spot but there was a lot of night life going on. I suggest you get a über if you need to get somewhere you need to be. Other than that I would definitely stay at this place again. Show more Kristna , United States Le Clarita 7.6 Very good Based on 98 reviews Except the location is near to the convenient store and bus store, it is not gd at all. In fact ,the hotel is in the alley not easy to find. The worst thing is that there is a poor sound proof . I can hear all the noise in the corridor and the street. Also there tiny staircase which is not quite reasonable for ppl to carry the luggages to walk. Last but not least, the door lock and shower heater are broken, totally awful. Show more suet , Hong Kong Sodsai Garden 7.6 Very good Based on 230 reviews Picked the hotel mostly for convenience to Airport rail and to mini vans leaving from Victory monument. Room was clean & comfortable. Quiet room and strong consistent WiFi. Mini fridge with free water & snacks a nice touch, as were the toiletries. Wet bath a little small but very serviceable. Bed & pillows comfortable, especially for Thailand. Day staff, “A” very helpful. Spoke serviceable English and made several calls for me to arrange my next hotel. Location good for all services, post office, Street food, restaurants, massage, currency exchange, 7-11, buses, Pratunam market, malls, etc. Approach from the south, the Soi was a little intimidating being small, dark and a little sketchy. But hotel had key entry so fairly secure. First stay was so good I immediately booked another room for when I returned to Bangkok to fly back home. Show more susan , United States Capetown Sriracha Residence 8.4 Excellent Based on 159 reviews My son enjoyed time there very much as the unit is quite big and he can walk (actually run) from one room to another easily. Even though there was no convenient store near the place, we could grab snacks and drinks from the guest lounge, and they were free of charge! The owner was so generous and quite thoughtful. Moreover, the staff was helpful and informative. Show more Oradee , Thailand Siamese Ratchakru 8.1 Excellent Based on 155 reviews Stayed in the 1BR which was nicely furnished and spacious. IMO shower water pressure a little low. No breakfast, but there is plenty of food to be found around BTS Ari (7min walk). Staff are friendly and helpful. 2-3 BTS stops to Chatuchat weekend market. Coming by taxi you need to watch out, as no real landmark or very visible signage. Show more Zhi , Singapore Int Place 7.4 Very good Based on 123 reviews Emerald Terrace Resort Patong 8.3 Excellent Based on 67 reviews Atlantis Resort Jomtien Beach by Bakuri Hostility 6.9 Good Based on 39 reviews Like Sukhumvit 22 7.6 Very good Based on 60 reviews Loved the apartment! Felt like home the minute we walked in. Located a lovely area away from the noise but close enough to the shopping malls and a short walk to the night market. Stayed for two nights. Our host Rham, made the experience so memorable! Gave us a train map and advised where to go and how to get there. Almost like a tour guide!! Would definitely recommend to a friend and I'll be sure to stay here again. Show more Fatimat , United Kingdom Atlantis Condo Resort by Yating 7.5 Very good Based on 38 reviews The Unity Patong Private Apartment 7.7 Very good Based on 98 reviews The unity is made up of two hotels, Unity and Unity 2 (also known as The Bliss). We were actually in The Bliss which is the newer of the two offerings. We really enjoyed the spacious rooms (we had a studio) and the roof top pool overlooking patong bay. Unfortunately, we had a very bad smell coming from our bathroom for the duration of our stay which was unable to be resolved. The staff were excellent and did their best to help out. Show more Robert , Australia D'well Residence@Don Muang 7.1 Very good Based on 88 reviews I like that they have an airport pickup but they should have told where to pick us up though. Lol. Saying airport pickup, I expected to wait at the airport but actually it's not, we have to cross the road by waling bridges to the opposite hotel named Amari to wait for the pick up. It's not a complaint thou but I should have told first since I called and asked about the pickup. All in all, the location is near the airport. It's clean but breakfast is various. Show more Lalida , Thailand S Apartment 9 Excellent Based on 74 reviews the base ibis 6.5 Good Based on 8 reviews My Resort Huahin By Grandroomservices 7.4 Very good Based on 68 reviews This place is very new. The room is quite big. It could hold upto 8 ppl max. The room condition is very nice and clean with everything you need in it. However, this place is a property for rent, not the hotel, so do not expect for the hotel reception or bell boy. The key will be leave at the security personal at the entrance. In overall, this place is worth for the money you have paid. I really appreciated it. Show more Siriorn , Thailand ZEN Rooms Sukhumvit Soi 18 7.2 Very good Based on 44 reviews Nord Studio 9 Excellent Based on 28 reviews Patt Serviced Apartments 8.1 Excellent Based on 182 reviews Good,friendly staff in the Service Apartment. Overall stay pleasant, near local food, 7-11, pretty near to shopping mall. Wi Fi in room needs to be connected often but still ok and will recommend to all wanting to stay here. Show more Choh , Singapore crystal suites pattaya 7.7 Very good Based on 27 reviews Implace Impact @ Msociety Condo 7.8 Very good Based on 71 reviews We had a comfortable stay. Most things were positive and according to expectation. One area we could recommend improvement is in communication. We had no local language so found it very difficult to know anything about the accomodation (even where the public areas for wifi were located)or where we were in Bangkok and how to get to places of interest, catch transport etc. We relied upon people living or staying within the building or outside who we met by chance. Show more Jill , Australia Baan Sansuk Beachfront Condominium 7.5 Very good Based on 25 reviews Panitar Haus 7.6 Very good Based on 188 reviews Initially first impressions were very good, it's clean and quite stylish and the pool is superb. Once 6. 30-7pm arrived the two very big food places either side played very loud live non stop music until 12 midnight, every night, it was like being in between two very loud speakers. I very rarely get headaches and on the first night within 2 hours of the music playing I had one, couldn't even here our tv unless it was turned right up but that didn't drown the music out. This year we travelled 3000 mikes by car around thailand and stayed in lots of places. We've been doing this yearly since 1999, so as you can image we've probably stayed in a hundred places in thailand. We've been next to bars before and clubs so it's not like we just choose areas that are noise free but this place is horrendous. You've been warned!
